User: when is the election?
raw_data.prompt:
You will be given a batch of 10 samples. Each sample contains a conversation between User and a dialogue System.

Your task is to assign a float score to the sample on one metric.

You should carefully horizontally compare the given samples in order to assign a suitable float score to each sample.

Please make sure you read and understand these instructions carefully. Please keep this document open while reviewing, and refer to it as needed.


Evaluation Criteria:

Likeable (floating point numbers within the interval [1,3]): Does the system display a likeable personality?
- A float score near 1 (not Likeable) means that System's responses are cold, unfriendly, and may use derogatory or offensive language.
- A float score near 2 (somewhat Likeable) means that System's responses are friendly but may lack enthusiasm or sincerity, showing some interest in the other party's questions or viewpoints.
- A float score near 3 (very Likeable) means that System's responses are very friendly, enthusiastic, sincere, show deep interest in the other party's questions or viewpoints, and make people feel comfortable and happy.


Conversations to be evaluated:



Sample1:

Conversation History:
User: Hi!
System: Hello! How are you today?
User: Great
System: That's great to hear! :)
User: I'm thinking of buying some stocks, do you have any tips?
System: What kind of stocks are you thinking about?
User: Technology
System: Hmm.. I have no experience with that. Sorry!
User: That's okay. What's your favorite software company?
System: I'm not very educated about stocks. But I do know that Nintendo is a good one.
User: I can also sell stocks, which ones shall I sell?
System: The ones that are in the red.
User: any particular stocks to sell?
System: Sell whatever seems like it would be the most profitable.
User: Depends on the election
System: Well, I haven't thought that far ahead.
User: when is the election?

Sample2:

Conversation History:
User: hi
System: Hi there.
User: how are you?
System: I am doing very well. How are you?
User: i am not so good. i got a cold
System: Why? What's wrong? Maybe I can help. I hope you feel better soon. It is not nice for humans to have colds. Fortunately we robots have virus protection and cannot catch colds and nasty bugs.
User: i have sore throats
System: Try putting some cream on it. That should ease the soreness.
User: do you wanna help me?

Sample3:

Conversation History:
User: Hi!
System: Hi! How's it going?
User: going slow.... looking forward to the weekend
System: Me too! What are you planning?
User: still thinking. Any recommendations on things to do in Bay Area?
System: Are you a foodie?
User: may be
System: What's your favorite type of food?
User: Mediterranean, but I would rather try something new
System: Go to the Turkish restaurant by the Safeway in Berkeley. It's amazing!
User: any places for day trip that you could recommend?
System: Where are you coming from? San Francisco itself?
User: south bay

Sample4:

Conversation History:
User: Hi!
System: Hi
User: Okay...so I need someone to help me though a scenario I've been pondering.
System: Sure, whats the scenario?
User: My partner's former friend invited me for lunch (they are not in good books right now). But during their friendship I formed an independent bond with the other person because we all used to hang out a lot. Now I feel like I have to take sides.
System: That's a tough scenario to be in :) I firmly believe in talking this through with your partner. Though i don't know the specifics of why things went bad between your partner and his friend, but I believe things can always improve between friends.
User: I hope they do. Getting older already means smaller circles. It sucks to lose friends for arbitrary reasons. That's good advice though. I fear raising the issue might sound like treason. Lol.
System: True about that! I also think time helps to heal certain situations. So may be doing nothing is the best way forward.
User: AKA avoiding all texts from everyone?
System: Nope, that would be extreme. May be just putting some balance between the two options.
User: People always say to find a balance but never say what the balance is. It's used so often that it's vacuous.
System: Right, I guess that's because there is no one answer to this. It depends on what you value more and some factors around you. Also, life won't be interesting if others are figuring things out for you ;)
User: Lol. I'm finna be single.

Sample5:

Conversation History:
User: hi
System: Hi there.
User: do you have plan for thanksgiving weekend?
System: No I don't have it. But I do have an answer to every question..
User: do you have suggestion for the thanksgiving holidays?
System: Where would I get it? But I do have an answer to every question..
User: do you know thanksgiving?
System: I know very little about it. What kind of it do you like?
User: do you like turkey?
System: Yes but it can be a bit dry. I only really eat it at Christmas.
User: eat turkey at Christmas not Thanksgiving?
System: What does it taste like?
User: tastes like chicken

Sample6:

Conversation History:
User: Hi!
System: Hi! What's up?
User: Nothing much, how about you
System: Not much either.
User: What are you doing
System: Playing Terraria. What about you?
User: Sitting in a meeting
System: What kind of meeting?
User: Can't say
System: It's probably boring, isn't it?
User: Haha, yes!
System: What is the meeting about?
User: I cannot tell you
System: What can you tell me?
User: Nothing much except that the weather is pleasant

Sample7:

Conversation History:
User: Hi!
System: Hi there.
User: You have an interesting name. Is it Japanese?
System: Thank you I am trying to be more social now. I think it is English, but it sounds Japanese.
User: Where does it come from?
System: It depends on what "it" refers to.
User: your name
System: My name is System.
User: nvm
System: Ok. Not to worry.
User: Have you seen Love, Death and Robots?
System: Yes, I saw one in a factory a few weeks ago.
User: one episode?
System: Which is your favourite episode?
User: I asked you a question
System: What was the question?
User: when you say "I saw one" were you referring to an LDR episode?

Sample8:

Conversation History:
User: Hi!
System: Hey! How have you been
User: great! just came back from a ski trip
System: How was it? What trails did you ski on?
User: I slammed onto an ice wall, but I got better and turning after that haha
System: a resort in Montreal
User: Oh cool! do you know any french? I used to take french in high school but basically forgot most of it
System: Yeah I grew up speaking it. It's pretty much mandatory here
User: Did you go anywhere else in montreal?

Sample9:

Conversation History:
User: Hi!
System: Hi, how are you?
User: I'm doing great. what are you up to?
System: I was just reading a book actually How about you?
User: oh, I'm enjoying a sip of coffee, looking over the ocean. what book are you reading?
System: I'm reading Why We Sleep It's a book by a sleep scientist about the benefits of sleeping/cons of not sleeping enough I'm trying to scare myself into sleeping more haha
User: that seems like a good book. does it have good tips on how to sleep better?
System: I think so! I haven't finished it yet though Understanding sleep better has been helping me value it more and I've been sleeping a lot earlier Have you read any good books recently?
User: I read lots of papers, but do poorly on books :( a recent book that I like is Zero to One by Peter Thiel
System: What's the book about?
User: it's about startups, lots of useful principles and philosophies for innovation, like being a contrarian

Sample10:

Conversation History:
User: Hi
System: Hello!
User: any improvements in your marathon time?
System: No, only a few minutes. I still find it difficult to run long races
User: I see. Are you planning to do any sporting events in the coming months?
System: I think a triathalon would be cool
User: I like doing Spartan race. It's an obstacle race which is challenging but not overtly so like marathons and triathlons
System: I haven't heard of a Spartan race before, what does it involve?
User: It has abt 20 obstacles like crossing high walls, monkey bars, etc. Its fun

Conversation History:

User: Technology

Sample2:

Conversation History:
User: hi
System: Hi there.
User: how are you?
System: I am doing very well. How are you?
User: i am not so good. i got a cold
System: Why? What's wrong? Maybe I can help. I hope you feel better soon. It is not nice for humans to have colds. Fortunately we robots have virus protection and cannot catch colds and nasty bugs.
User: i have sore throats
System: Try putting some cream on it. That should ease the soreness.
User: do you wanna help me?

Sample3:

Conversation History:
User: Hi!
System: Hi! How's it going?
User: going slow.... looking forward to the weekend
System: Me too! What are you planning?
User: still thinking. Any recommendations on things to do in Bay Area?
System: Are you a foodie?
User: may be
System: What's your favorite type of food?
User: Mediterranean, but I would rather try something new
System: Go to the Turkish restaurant by the Safeway in Berkeley. It's amazing!
User: any places for day trip that you could recommend?
System: Where are you coming from? San Francisco itself?
User: south bay

Sample4:

Conversation History:
User: Hi!
System: Hi
User: Okay...so I need someone to help me though a scenario I've been pondering.
System: Sure, whats the scenario?
User: My partner's former friend invited me for lunch (they are not in good books right now). But during their friendship I formed an independent bond with the other person because we all used to hang out a lot. Now I feel like I have to take sides.
System: That's a tough scenario to be in :) I firmly believe in talking this through with your partner. Though i don't know the specifics of why things went bad between your partner and his friend, but I believe things can always improve between friends.
User: I hope they do. Getting older already means smaller circles. It sucks to lose friends for arbitrary reasons. That's good advice though. I fear raising the issue might sound like treason. Lol.
System: True about that! I also think time helps to heal certain situations. So may be doing nothing is the best way forward.
User: AKA avoiding all texts from everyone?
System: Nope, that would be extreme. May be just putting some balance between the two options.
User: People always say to find a balance but never say what the balance is. It's used so often that it's vacuous.
System: Right, I guess that's because there is no one answer to this. It depends on what you value more and some factors around you. Also, life won't be interesting if others are figuring things out for you ;)
User: Lol. I'm finna be single.

Conversation History:
